data.title: Lobby : sound notifications
data.body:
What about adding sound notifications for the lobby ?

There are two events that could benefit from them:
- when an admin has created a game and waits for players to join.
  for each new player who joins his game, a sound notification could warn him that someone joined (that something is happening in the lobby). Sometimes admins create games, wait for players and do other things in the meantime (and don't pay attention to the game anymore)
- when all other players clicked on their "ready" checkboxes. In this case, sometimes, THEY wait for the admin to come back..

data.title: Wish .aud converter and player
data.body:
Now Joo made a great guide here: http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=16196&highlight=aud, but still, it is hard to work with .aud files. Since they are in map, and the editor will be more complete, an .aud converter and player could be there later if anyone wanne code it. Convert form wave or ogg is more than fine...

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: New Map Editor : a toolbar
data.body:
Hello.

To keep an overview of what has been done for the New Map Editor, I decided to extract features/ideas from this other post: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2805 and split them in several issues.

The New Map Editor could feature a toolbar with buttons like:
- new map, open map, save, undo, redo, show/hide grid, zoom, pan, add tile, fill, erase, tile finder, palette, map properties, resize map...

![552273ScreenShot001](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311077/06ad233c-9730-11e2-8246-f59e2c319484.png)

data.title: Localisation
data.body:
After the discussion at http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=15948 I started to hack on OpenRA l10n. There are some quite a lot of fan translations of OpenRA and Red Alert on the net. I collected my findings at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Translation

Some sub-tasks:
- [x] Add a language selector to settings GUI (trivial)
- [x] "HOLD", "READY" are translatable via YAML #2526
- [x] "Requires:" and CustomPrerequisites are translatable via YAML #2526
- [ ] Voice/Icon gamefile downloader GUI (optional)
- [ ] Auto-adjust layout/size of Widges on text size
- [ ] [textless icons](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&t=15353) nearly finished, we could then print the unit names live on them without photo-shopping or just go for the tooltips only

Some strings are hard-coded and not exposed to YAML editing (yet):
- [x] "Primary" (check if this is still an SHP)
- [x] Tabs mouseover ("Buildings", "Defense", "Infrantry", ...)
- [x] DropDownBox contents
- [x] Text in *LoadScreen, *InstallLogic, ...
- [x] Singleplayer objectives

data.title: fix RA Desert palette rotation regressions

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: This partly reverts commit db7887687b17f594a80ab537cc5e1ecdfee82ae6 by @pchote.

data.title: disallow same/similar colors
data.body:
It would be nice if we find a way to prevent players having the same color. Its always confusing if you can't distinguish your own units from the enemy's.
Either we use a dropdown with a preset list of colors. Or we come up a with an algorithm that opts out colors already taken (or very similar ones).

data.title: Battlecontrol initialized!
data.body: I added an announcer voice upon game start. This fixes #2190. Thanks to @Nyerguds for mixing this together for the RA mod!

data.title: Bring the Diplomacy menu back to life...
data.body:
..., but
- rename LockTeams to FragileAlliances to avoid confusion
- only allow it in Free-For-All, not Team games or Missions
- grey out non-functional buttons and disabled checkboxes

data.title: Update RADOC
data.body: I cleaned up the wiki and added it to the source code. Also found some comments in the code that could be exposed. There is no need to update https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits manually anymore. It will be done automatically beginning from the next playtest/release.

data.title: Ranking Games and new Lobby window
data.body:
Hello.

Multiplayer games could become even more interesting if a Ranking system was implemented.

Concept:
- Players who want their game to be part of the ranking would just have to enable a checkbox during the game creation
- Winners of ranking games would be "recorded" and results could be sent to a database (on the website)
- The best players would see their ranking rise and their names listed in a table, on the website
- The ranking could last one month but there could be statistics for 3 months, 6 months, a year...
- Over a season, each player would be able to know his personal statistics such as: 
  number of games won, number of games lost, number of games played, pourcentage of 
  games won, the fastest game won..

To support this new Ranking system, the lobby would have to be changed a bit.
It should feature options to filter games, find players easily, ...

Here is a mockup:
![607690newlobby1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311051/1d192310-972f-11e2-9388-5d7ccb2dd111.jpg)
- The lobby could be upgraded to allow chatting with all connected players (in a global chatroom)
- There would also be a drop-down menu to filter games by OpenRA version, by mod, by type (standard games, private games (invite-only), ranking game)
  Mockup: 
  ![630164newlobby2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311052/25239c0c-972f-11e2-9aea-7a5d0d38c22e.jpg)
- The Players list (on the left) could also be sorted
  Mockup:
  ![787501newlobby3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/311053/2cb31600-972f-11e2-983d-5d3a917c6f6a.jpg)
- A new button could be added to randomly join any open game

data.title: Yet Another Desync Debug Pull Request
data.body:
I am dumping more values that depend on floating point operation or random number calculation to the `syncreport.log` the hacky way @pchote described earlier in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/2796#issuecomment-15209761.

Also decided that Explodes and CarpetBomb deserve an ISync tag as well as choosing which explosion sound to play does not justify a desync and should therefore CosmeticRandom instead.

data.title: Desura compatibilty
data.body: You currently can't install/start OpenRA on the Desurium Linux client on. To fix this we are currently unpublished from http://www.desura.com/games/openra by DesuraNET staff. I already tweaked the install settings and prepared this patch for OpenRA. I do the MCF generation from a fresh install of an RPM from `/usr/share/openra` for Linux and NSIS Setup.exe from `Program Files/OpenRA` for Windows. Left some documentation on https://github.com/lodle/Desurium/wiki/Notes-For-Publishing-On-Desura because it is quirky.

data.title: BadImageFormatException when accessing OpenRA.Game via OpenRA.Utility
data.body:
Received args: --docs ra
System.BadImageFormatException: Could not load file or assembly 'OpenRA.Game, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. An attempt was made to load a program with an incorrect format.
File name: 'OpenRA.Game, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'
   at OpenRA.Utility.Command.ExtractTraitDocs(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main(String[] args) in c:\Users\Scott\Code\OpenRA\OpenRA.Utility\Program.cs:line 42

Pre-bind state information
LOG: User = Jupiter\Scott
LOG: DisplayName = OpenRA.Game, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null
 (Fully-specified)
LOG: Appbase = file:///C:/Users/Scott/Code/OpenRA/
LOG: Initial PrivatePath = NULL
Calling assembly : OpenRA.Utility, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null.

LOG: This bind starts in default load context.
LOG: No application configuration file found.
LOG: Using machine configuration file from C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v2.0.50727\config\machine.config.
LOG: Policy not being applied to reference at this time (private, custom, partial, or location-based assembly bind).
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Users/Scott/Code/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game.DLL.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Users/Scott/Code/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game/OpenRA.Game.DLL.
LOG: Attempting download of new URL file:///C:/Users/Scott/Code/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game.EXE.
ERR: Failed to complete setup of assembly (hr = 0x8007000b). Probing terminated.

I've also had this happen with some of my own test code which accessed OpenRA.Game.
Seems to happen with .NET only.

data.title: De-couple edge-scrolling and keyboard-scrolling
data.body:
Feature request: 

As OpenRA is now, I don't think it's possible to turn off only edge-scrolling in game, while keeping keyboard scrolling. 

The existing 'enable edge scrolling' (at least, in playtest 20130316) only turns off both, but it would be ideal if  perhaps there were two buttons, one to allow each option.
